text: José Mário Branco (25 May 1945 - 19 November 2019) was a Portuguese singer- songwriter, actor, and record producer. He was a critic of the Salazar regime and as a result, he was exiled in France in 1963. He worked with musicians Sérgio Godinho and Zeca Afonso, whose records he produced and recorded at the Château d'Hérouville studios. Branco died of a stroke on 19 November 2019 at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Portuguese singers Category:Portuguese activists Category:Singer- songwriters Category:Portuguese writers Category:Portuguese movie actors Category:Record producers
title: José Mário Branco
